SEARCH

Class Problem

java.lang.Object
Problem
public class Problem extends Object
Represents an academic problem that can be associated with students, teachers, and projects. Maintains these associations while preventing duplicate entries using object equality checks.

    • Problem

      public Problem(int problemID, String problemName, String problemDescription)
      Constructs a new Problem with the specified identifier, name, and description.
      Parameters:
      problemID - the unique identifier for the problem
      problemName - the title/name of the problem
      problemDescription - a detailed explanation of the problem

      private boolean contains(Object[] array, Object obj)
      Checks if an object exists in the given array using Object.equals(Object).
      Parameters:
      array - the array to search
      obj - the object to find
      Returns:
      true if the object exists in the array, false otherwise

    • addStudent

      public void addStudent(Student student)
      Adds a student to the problem's association list if not already present. Uses Student.equals(Object) for duplicate checks.
      Parameters:
      student - the student to add

    • addTeacher

      public void addTeacher(Teacher teacher)
      Adds a teacher to the problem's association list if not already present. Uses Teacher.equals(Object) for duplicate checks.
      Parameters:
      teacher - the teacher to add

    • addProject

      public void addProject(Project project)
      Adds a project to the problem's association list if not already present. Uses Object.equals(Object) for duplicate checks.
      Parameters:
      project - the project to add

    • addMultipleProjects

      public void addMultipleProjects(Project[] projects)

    • getAllPersons

      public Person[] getAllPersons()
      Returns all persons (students and teachers) associated with the problem. The returned array is a new array containing references to the actual objects.
      Returns:
      a combined array of students and teachers in the order: students first, followed by teachers

    • getProjects

      public Project[] getProjects()
      Gets all projects associated with the problem. Note: The returned array is the internal projects array. Modifications to the array elements (e.g., via Project.setId(int)) will affect the problem's state.
      Returns:
      the array of projects associated with this problem
